H0.text: A timeline is the most appropriate display for a student who wants to organize a group of animals into two categories based on observable external features.

H1.text: A pie chart will most appropriately show the two categories of animals when a student organizes a group of animals into categories based on observable external features.

H2.text: A data table is the most appropriate display for organizing a group of animals into two categories based on observable external features, allowing the student to list each animal and its characteristics and sort them into the two categories.

H3.text: A line graph is the most appropriate display for a student who wants to organize a group of animals into two categories based on observable external features.

A4.text: Statisticians generally regard pie charts as a poor method of displaying information, and they are uncommon in scientific literature.

A5.text: A table contains quantitative data organized into rows and columns with categorical labels.

A6.text: A pie chart or bar chart can show the comparison of ratios, such as the market share represented by competitors in a market.
